attributes.action: HELP: Crimes Against Humanity, WAR Crimes & Human Rights Violated Harm & Redress
attributes.additional_details:
'Legally Ban' the removal & derailment of Components fitting Crimes Against Humanity, WAR Crimes & Human Rights violation in applicants redress submissions.

Compel redress teams to consider Planned Physical Elements of Daily Atrocities breaching ICC Article 7 - Crimes Against Humanity

With Major Wars in the world: eg Tigray War and Russian & Ukraine conflict. The UK must have home laws; to set an example & GOLD Standard in Redressing Crimes Against Humanity etc & stop accountability prevention
attributes.background:
UK Government must 'STOP Impunity' issues & recognition failures of historical, present & future Crimes Against Humanity etc.

Government must Create Laws to - 'Stop bad practices' in the
A) Investigation, B) Administration & C) Pay-Out: Of UK Redress Investigation & Compensation Pay-Out Schemes.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Under the International Criminal Court Act 2001 UK nationals and residents can be prosecuted for alleged offences of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity committed anywhere in the world. It's not clear what, if any, changes you want to be made to this, or other legislation.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
